channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The longest government shutdown in history is over—but flights and jobs data won’t return to normalcy yet
item.description: The House passed a bill last night to fund the government through Jan. 30, and President Trump signed it, reopening the federal government.

item.title: 10 new retail tech and AI trends that will define 2026

item.title: Want AI Adoption to Actually Be Successful? Train the C-Suite First
item.description: The prevailing assumption is that executives only need high-level briefings, not practical AI training. That’s wrong.

item.title: In just 15 years, the average U.S. homebuyer went from 39 to 59 years old: Top analyst reveals how the housing market has warped in one generation
item.description: The first-time homebuyer just hit 40 years old for the first time ever, but the average homebuyer is nearly a senior citizen.

item.title: FAA announces flight reductions at U.S. airports will stay at 6%

item.title: The AI Bubble Fears Are Getting Louder
item.description: AI infrastructure and demand is accelerating as risks are rising.

item.title: 5 Personal Finance Books That Make Building Wealth Seem Fun
item.description: One book will force you to compare your wealth-building skills to those of our nation’s presidents.

item.title: MacKenzie Scott makes more ‘life-changing,’ record-breaking gifts to historically Black colleges and universities—totaling more than $400 million
